about.title: About this Project
about.subtitle: Technologies and tools behind the podcast visualization

projectDescription.title: Project Description
projectDescription.content: This interactive AI application analyzes and visualizes the topics and speakers of podcasts over the years. Using AI-powered text analysis, semantic search, and clustering algorithms, topics are grouped and their temporal development is displayed in river diagrams. With speaker personas and discussion mode, questions can be answered in the style of the podcast hosts. The project was developed at 39C3.

multiPodcast.title: Multi-Podcast Support
multiPodcast.description: The application now supports multiple podcasts simultaneously. Each podcast has its own data, visualizations, and configurations.

features.selection: Podcast selection via dropdown in the header
features.organization: Podcast-specific data organization in separate directories
features.configuration: Easy extension with additional podcasts via podcasts.json
features.metadata: Configurable metadata per podcast (logo, tab name, URLs)

note.title: Note
note.content: All scripts support the --podcast parameter for podcast-specific processing. The data structure is fully multi-podcast capable.

embedding.title: OpenAI text-embedding-3-large
embedding.description: Generation of semantic embeddings for all podcast topics. Enables meaning-based clustering instead of just keyword matching.
